intro: Psychotria kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Guangxi region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Psychotria kwangsiensis is of interest to botanists due to its potential ecological and medicinal significance.
